properties.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Chuska Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; West Central Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 2:56AM MST until January 22 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...STORM TO BRING SNOW TO SOME WESTERN AND NORTHERN MOUNTAINS...

.A storm off the west coast will come inland tonight and race
across New Mexico Tuesday. There will be a decent tap of moisture
and the usual orographic lift. The result will be several inches
of snow over the western and northern high terrain.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of three to 6
inches above 7500 feet and one to three inches below 7500 feet.

* WHERE...Chuska Mountains, West Central Mountains, Tusas
Mountains Including Chama, Jemez Mountains and Southern Sangre
de Cristo Mountains.

* WHEN...From midnight tonight to midnight MST Tuesday night.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means
that periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties.
Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT MST TUESDAY NIGHT
